intro: Spermacoce occultiseta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its small, white flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or open habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine pubescence. The fruit is a capsule that dehisces to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
